solution_line_template: If Mallory gammy's house is {total_distance} miles away and she has to refill the fuel tank every {distance_per_tank} miles, she filled the tank {total_distance}/{distance_per_tank} = <<{total_distance}/{distance_per_tank}={num_refills}>>{num_refills} times.

If each refill costs ${cost_per_refill}, the total amount of money she used on refilling the tank is ${cost_per_refill}*{num_refills} = $<<{cost_per_refill}*{num_refills}={total_fuel_cost}>>{total_fuel_cost}

The food cost was {food_cost_fraction} times as much as the fuel costs, which is {food_cost_fraction}*${total_fuel_cost} = $<<{food_cost_fraction}*{total_fuel_cost}={total_food_cost}>>{total_food_cost}
On the whole journey, Mallory expenses on fuel and food costs are ${total_food_cost}+${total_fuel_cost} = $<<{total_food_cost}+{total_fuel_cost}={total_expenses}>>{total_expenses}
